titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archives of Irish America Newspapers and Periodicals Collection AIA 004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Marion Casey, Meaghan Dwyer, Mary Krinock, Rebecca Altermatt and Kaitlyn Medley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-05-04T17:10-0400

did.unittitle: Archives of Irish America Newspapers and Periodicals Collection
did.physloc: Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive
did.langmaterial: Majority of materials are in English; some are in Irish.
did.abstract: This collection contains major runs of several prominent Irish-American newspapers and periodicals. Titles held include Irish Echo, Irish Edition, Irish People, An Phoblacht / Republican News, Irish Voice, Irish World, An Gael (published by the Irish Arts Center, New York), Irish America, The Nation and The World of Hibernia.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The materials in this collection were collected by Archives staff or donated by various sources, including the Consulate General of Ireland, The Irish Bookshop, Cherry Lane Productions, Marion Casey, Linda Dowling Almeida, and Cormac K.H. O’Malley beginning in 1996. The 19th century papers were donated by Sean Prendiville.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open for research without restrictions. Some papers are fragile and must be handled with care, especially An Goadhal.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: irisharchives@library.nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Archives of Irish America Periodical Collection; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive; New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The materials in this collection were collected by Archives staff or donated by various sources, including the Consulate General of Ireland, The Irish Bookshop, Cherry Lane Productions, Marion Casey, Linda Dowling Almeida, and Cormac K. H. O’Malley beginning in 1996. The Nation and Spirit of Freedom were included in donations from Sean Prendiville and George Harrison. The nineteenth century papers were donated by Sean Prendiville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of runs of several major Irish-American newspapers and periodicals, including the Advocate (1968-1989), Irish People (1972-2004), An Phoblacht / Republican News the official newspaper of Sinn Fein (1984-2005), Irish Voice (1987-2003), and the Irish Echo (1964-2003). Also included are issues of other papers such as Irish World, Irish Herald and regional papers like the Boston Irish News, Irish American Press out of Southern California, and The Tablet from Queens and Brooklyn, New York. A few 19th-century papers are also found in the collection notably, the Irish Citizen (1871-1897), Green Banner (1836), the Shamrock(1811). The Phoenix out of New York (1859-1861) is included in microfilm format only.
Subseries were created for newspaper titles with multiple years, including The Advocate, An Phoblacht / Republican News, Irish Echo, Irish People and Irish Voice.

Of note in the publications series are The Nation, published by the Irish American Defense Fund and Spirit of Freedom, an Irish-American publication in support of the Republicans in Northern Ireland. Also of interest is a significant run of Irish America, a magazine focusing on Irish in America and famous Americans of Irish heritage, as well as Ireland of the Welcomes, a publication put out by the Ireland Tourist Board and an Irish- language serial, An Gadohal, a "bi-lingual magazine devoted to the promotion of the "Language Literature, Music and Art of Ireland" dating from the late 1800s to 1902.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are organized alphabetically by title and chronologically within each title.

The collection is arranged into two series: Newspapers and Periodicals. Within the newspapers are several subseries for newspapers with multiple years, including The Advocate, An Phoblacht / Republican News, Irish Echo, Irish People and Irish Voice.
